FuncDef:
The remote end-op command configures a remote End.OP SID with a specified mask length.
The undo remote end-op command deletes a specified remote End.OP SID.
By default, the remote End.OP SID is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Remote End.OP SID.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Length of the prefix.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 128.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a remote End.OP SID with a specified mask length, run this command in the segment routing IPv6 view.
Pay attention to the following aspects during the configuration:
 Multiple remote End.OP SIDs can be configured at the same time. The maximum number of remote End.OP SIDs can be customized. By default, the maximum number is 4096. The prefix and mask length of the configured SID cannot conflict with each other.
